net.sf.jclal.util.matrixFile

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jclal.util.matrixFile.Matrix

  • public class Matrix
extends Object
    Utility class to handle a matrix over the main memory or over a file.
    Author:
    Oscar Reyes Pupo, Eduardo Perez Perdomo

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Matrix

        public Matrix(int m,
              int n,
              boolean overFile)
       throws Exception
        The default value of the matrix is 0. The user does not have to worry about establishing the path of the matrix file, a temporal file is automatically created.
        Parameters:
        m - The number of rows.
        n - The number of columns.
        overFile - Indicates if the matrix will be stored over a file
        Throws:
        Exception - The exception that will be launched.

      • Matrix

        public Matrix(int m,
              int n,
              double s,
              boolean overFile)
        Construct an m-by-n constant matrix.
        Parameters:
        m - Number of rows.
        n - Number of colums.
        s - Fill the matrix with this scalar value.
        overFile - Indicates if the matrix will be stored over a file

      • Matrix

        public Matrix(double[][] arr,
              boolean overFile)
        Construct a matrix from a 2-D array.
        Parameters:
        arr - Two-dimensional array of doubles.
        overFile - Indicates if the matrix will be stored over a file
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - All rows must have the same length

      • Matrix

        n - Number of colums.
        overFile - Indicates if the matrix will be stored over a file

      • Matrix

        public Matrix(double[] vals,
              int m,
              boolean overFile)
        Construct a matrix from a one-dimensional array
        Parameters:
        vals - One-dimensional array of doubles, packed by columns (ala Fortran).
        m - Number of rows.
        overFile - Indicates if the matrix will be stored over a file
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Array length must be a multiple of m.

      • times

        public Matrix times(Matrix B)
        Linear algebraic matrix multiplication, A * B
        Parameters:
        B - another matrix
        Returns:
        Matrix product, A * B
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Matrix inner dimensions must agree.

      • trace

        public double trace()
        Matrix trace.
        Returns:
        sum of the diagonal elements.

      • random

        public static Matrix random(int m,
                            int n,
                            boolean overFile)
        Generate matrix with random elements
        Parameters:
        m - Number of rows.
        n - Number of colums.
        overFile - Indicates if the matrix will be stored over a file
        Returns:
        An m-by-n matrix with uniformly distributed random elements.

      • identity

        public static Matrix identity(int m,
                              int n,
                              boolean overFile)
        Generate identity matrix
        Parameters:
        m - Number of rows.
        n - Number of colums.
        overFile - Indicates if the matrix is stored over the a file or over the main memory
        Returns:
        An m-by-n matrix with ones on the diagonal and zeros elsewhere.

      • print

        public void print(PrintWriter output,
                  NumberFormat format,
                  int width)
        Print the matrix to the output stream. Line the elements up in columns. Use the format object, and right justify within columns of width characters. Note that is the matrix is to be read back in, you probably will want to use a NumberFormat that is set to US Locale.
        Parameters:
        output - the output stream.
        format - A formatting object to format the matrix elements
        width - Column width.
        See Also:
        DecimalFormat.setDecimalFormatSymbols(java.text.DecimalFormatSymbols)

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroy the matrix

        public void destroyOnExit()
        Destroy the matrix

                           int column)
        Verifies if the dimensions are in the correct range
        Parameters:
        row - The row
        column - The column
        Returns:
        Returns if the dimensions are in the correct range.

      • pos

        public long pos(int row,
                int column)
        It finds the position where the value is in the file
        Parameters:
        row - The row
        column - The column
        Returns:
        The position where the value is in the file.

      • isOverFile

        public boolean isOverFile()
        Denote if the matrix is stored over a file and not over the main memory, by default the the matrix is stored over the main memory
        Returns:
        Whether the stored data is over file or not/

      • setOverFile

        public void setOverFile(boolean overFile)
        Denote if the matrix is stored over a file and not over the main memory, by default the the matrix is stored over the main memory
        Parameters:
        overFile - Set whether the data will be stored over a file or main memory.
